DOUBLE LAYER REPLACEMENT REQUIREMENTS:

Per IRC Section R908.3 (VA/MD/PA): 'Roof replacement shall include the removal of ALL existing layers of roof coverings down to the roof deck.'

IRC Section 1511.3.1.1 – Roof recover is PROHIBITED when TWO OR MORE layers exist.

Implications:
- No recover or overlay on double layers
- Only full replacement with complete tear-off is code-compliant

Argument:
'Code prohibits roof recover on double-layer roofs (1511.3.1.1). Full tear-off is required.'

LOW SLOPE / FLAT ROOF REQUIREMENTS:

Virginia Residential Code R905.2.2: 'Asphalt shingles shall be used only on roof slopes of 2:12 or greater.'

Implications:
- Minimum slope: 2:12 for shingles
- Below 2:12 requires low-slope systems (TPO/EPDM, etc.)
- Shingles on low-slope roofs violate code

Argument:
'Existing slope below 2:12 violates R905.2.2 for shingles; use appropriate low-slope system.'

MARYLAND MATCHING REQUIREMENTS:

Maryland Insurance Administration Bulletin 18-23: Like kind & quality required.
Maryland Code §27-303: Failing to match materials is an unfair settlement practice.

Implications:
- Discontinued shingles justify replacing entire visible slope/section for uniformity

Argument:
'MD law requires matching; with discontinued shingles, replace the entire section to maintain uniform appearance.'

GAF MANUFACTURER REQUIREMENTS:

GAF Storm Damage Guidelines: Creased shingles have lost sealant bond and cannot be repaired; replacement required.

Implications:
- Creasing = functional damage
- Repairs void warranty

Argument:
'GAF requires replacement of creased shingles; repair attempts void warranty.'

STORM DATE VERIFICATION:

Collect NOAA Storm Events, NWS reports, photos with timestamps, neighbor claims, emergency reports.

Script:
'The storm date of [date] is verified by NOAA. We have timestamped photos and corroborating evidence. Please re-inspect and review the documented record.'

HANDLING PUSHBACK & DENIALS:

1) Document everything
2) Identify pushback type
3) Escalation: Teammates → Team Lead → Sales Manager → Arbitration
4) Stay professional

Mindset: Pushback indicates exposure — your claim likely has merit.

FULL APPROVAL PHONE CALL SCRIPT:

1) Congratulate & confirm scope
2) Explain payment structure
3) Schedule immediately
4) Contract & deposit
5) Documents needed
6) Set expectations
7) Close & commit

Follow-up: If no signature the same day, call/text immediately.
